intro: Ehretia siamensis, commonly known as Siam hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
